subject: Re: [junit] Re: junit
msgSnippet: ... I meant this: public class MyTestCase extends TestCase { // ... tests ... public static void main(String[] args) { junit.textui.TestRunner.main(new
messageBody:
shinobu@... wrote:

>
> > It is common to write main() in each Test Case class like this.
> >
> > public class MyTestCase extends TestCase {
> > // ... tests ...
> > public static void main(String[] args) {
> > junit.textui.TestRunner.main(args);
> > }
> > }
>
> I'd rather have it test itself. ;-)
>
> public class MyTestCase extends TestCase {
> public static void main(String[] args) {
> junit.swingui.TestRunner.run(MyTestCase.class);
> }
> }

I meant this:

public class MyTestCase extends TestCase {
// ... tests ...
public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.main(new String[]
{MyTestCase.class.getName()});
}
}
